required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Age and BMI on Liver Transplant Outcomes
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Advanced Age and High BMI on Short-term Outcomes in Live-donor Liver Transplant Recipients

brief_summary.textblock: Prospectively enrolled retrospective chart review and Liver Transplant database review to determine the modifiable and nonmodifiable risk factors specifically relating to Living Donor Liver Transplants. To observe the impact of age and BMI on graft outcomes and whether they impact the intraoperative management, post-operative length of stay, and complications.

detailed_description.textblock: There has been a great deal of research into the characteristics of the donor for organ transplant, with older donors and those with more comorbidities having worse function once the organ is implanted. There has not been a great deal of research in the United States about the recipient's characteristic including age and BMI and the effects on donor organ function. With increasingly expanded criteria for organ recipients especially in the field of living donor organs the investigators plan to show the impact of older age and increased BMI on newly transplanted organs.

primary_outcome.description: How well does the organ function

secondary_outcome.description: Any complications in the perioperative period

secondary_outcome.measure: Length of Stay- Total and ICU
secondary_outcome.description: How long after surgery before patient is discharged from ICU and from Hospital
Time from Surgery End to Extubation or no longer requiring ventilatory support
Complications in the postoperative period- Renal, Infectious Disease, Pulmonary, Cardiac, Transplant related, Reintubation, Reoperation
Amount of blood transfusion required intraoperatively
Amount and Type of Vasoactive Medication used at procedure end

arm_group.description: Patients who have received a living donor liver transplant.
Patients who have received either a Deceased by Circulatory Death or Deceased by Brain Death Liver Transplant

study_pop.textblock: Patients with end-stage liver disease, cirrhosis, or cancer requiring a liver transplant.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients who received a liver transplant at UPMC- Montefiore Hospital Age> 18
Exclusion Criteria:
- Excludes Children (<18 years old) as they do not receive their operation under the same protocols Lost to follow-up prior to 1 year Participation in alternate research protocol that significantly altered the care they received in the perioperative period that may make their inclusion skew results.
